posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Mkay.

This build idea I am trying to build takes all the good parts and synergy from the component classes and combines them together.

This build is for WoG.

The main problem I am having is getting Bane of Enemies while also trying to keep the highest BaB.

This build dual-wields kamas, and has Dev Crit.

Main Stats are Str and Wis (Wis giving both Ranger spells and Monk AC bonus, meaning no armor).

I believe that the build allows max tumble bonus, high listen, spot, and search, with high disc as well (all wanted skills).

So how do I go about doing this?

Is there a way to go 20 levels of Ranger pre-epic, then somehow using the 1 left over Ranger level somewhere in Epic to pick up BoE?

It is here that I have been having difficulties with the build - getting BoE with just 21 Ranger levels.

I could go Ranger/WM pre-epic, but that means I burn a feat for kamas, which I don't have to because Monk gets them for free - but taking a level of Monk pre-epic hits my max BaB iirc.

Monk also gives Cleave, which saves a feat for Dev Crit, not to mention for 12 levels all kinds of extra goodness (including diamond soul, which provides good, non-lowerable SR).

That I want to keep.

WM 7 is necessary for the usual reasons.

Help would be appreciated.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
webshaman1 wrote: Is there a way to go 20 levels of Ranger pre-epic, then somehow using the 1 left over Ranger level somewhere in Epic to pick up BoE?
Of course, as long as you take that Ranger level at an epic feat level (21, 24, 27, etc.) you could select BoE for it.
But, I see no reason to take Monk to level 12, for that tiny SR 22.
You need epic feats to burn & Ranger 26/ Monk 7/ Weapon-Master 7, will get you 3 of them & un-dispellable as well.
Str: 16  Dex: 14  Con: 10  Int: 14  Wis: 14  Cha: 08 (Human) is a nice starting stat-spread, without over-optimizing.
Between Ranger & Monk levels you get (Ambi, Twf, Itwf, Kd, Ikd, Cl) for free, which will help a lot with the pre-requisites.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi Webby

Warmest regards as always.

Tried my best to make something for you with Valerfor's suggested set up. 

Got the AB to 42. Has Blind Fight and Improved Knockdown, max tumble. +6 AB/Dmg against favored enemies. 250 odd spare skill points for you to allocate as you please.

I think I got the Str high enough to make Dev Crit useful here, with Str Capped it will be 40. 10 + 40/2 (level/2) + 15 (str modifier) = Dev Crit DC 45. 
SpoilerRanger(26), Monk(7), Weapon Master(7), Human STR: 16 (28) CON: 10 INT: 14 01: Monk(1): Mobility, Dodge, {Cleave, Evasion, Improved Unarmed Strike, Stunning Fist} 03: Ranger(2): Weapon Focus (Kama) 05: Ranger(4) 07: Monk(2): {Deflect Arrows} 09: Ranger(7): Spring Attack 11: Ranger(9): {Improved Two-Weapon Fighting} 13: Weapon Master(1): Weapon of Choice (Kama) 15: Weapon Master(3): Improved Critical (Kama) 17: Monk(4) 19: Weapon Master(6) 21: Monk(5): Great Strength I, (STR=22) 23: Ranger(10): Favored Enemy III 25: Ranger(12) 27: Ranger(14): Great Cleave 29: Ranger(16) 31: Ranger(18) 33: Ranger(20): Devastating Critical (Kama), Favored Enemy V 35: Ranger(22) 37: Monk(7) 39: Ranger(25): Great Strength II, Epic Weapon Focus (Kama), (STR=27) Skillpoints: 287 Saving Throw bonuses: Mind Effects: +2 AB (max, naked): 42 (melee), 32 (ranged) Spell Casting: Ranger(4) 01: Intimidate(2), Save(24),  03: Intimidate(1), Save(36),  05: Intimidate(1), Save(48),  07: Tumble(10), Save(52),  09: Save(66),  11: Save(80),  13: Save(87),  15: Save(97),  17: Tumble(5), Save(104),  19: Save(114),  21: Save(126),  23: Save(135),  25: Save(149),  27: Save(163),  29: Save(177),  31: Save(191),  33: Save(205),  35: Save(219),  37: Tumble(15), Save(218),  39: Save(232), 
Let me know if it suits.

Non fighter weapon masters are tough to make well.

I thought it needs too many feats pre-epic (weapon master and dev crit requirements) for me to delay Monk until 21, I wanted those Cleave and Kama weapon proficiency feats earlier. 

But I will think about whether I can make it work. If I have some time tomorrow I will see if I can make it work with a Ranger 20 level split pre-epic

Gonna get some sleep.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi Web

I went to bed but then thought maybe Half-Orc might be a good choice here if you want to go Ranger 20 pre-epic for +1 AB.

So I had a go at making something for you. Has about 150 skill points left over after meeting requirements for WM and 40 tumble.

But I got the AB to 43, which is pretty nice. 1AB = +5% chance to hit and crit :)

Weapon master goodies come late but if you are happy to delay knockdown and improved knockdown till level 39 then swap some monk levels with WM

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Mkay, I have changed things a bit so that Monk is now level 12 (looses a few feats, but I think it is worth it for that sweet SR).

The main problem with a Kama user on WoG is, believe it or not, damage output.

Even with custom made, socket Kamas (Keened, of course ;) ) the low slashing damage, even when paired with high Str, just doesn't do enough to some opponents on WoG.

The same goes for the loss of AB - it is just a tick too much for most builds to handle.

I built a Kama blizzard of destruction based on some fighter levels instead of Ranger, but go nowhere near what this build is packing in damage and AB, especially against FEs.  So this build really relies on CRUCIAL FE selection!

FE 1 should be goblinoids.  This will help you pretty much through up into low Epic levels on WoG (I know, hard to believe, but there are "almost Epic" gobbos on WoG :/  - and they are packing hps! - I've gone through almost 50 arrows trying to bring just one down as an AA!!!!!)

FE2 I think should be Undead.  WoG has lots of Undead, from beginning up to end Epic level.

FE3 I take Giants.  The Giant quests, especially the Fire Giants, almost screams for this.

FE4 Humans - there are enough human opponents (and bosses) to warrant this, especially in the low to high epic levels.

FE5 Elves - this is due to the rather deadly Drow that one will run into, and the occasional rebel elfess.

If anyone who knows WoG can think of a better selection of FEs (or maybe rearrange what I have here) feel free to chime in!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Good builds, Orion, both of them.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Web I think you are the expert on the FE topic here, :) particularly given this thread (https://www.tapatalk.com/groups/worldof ... t4782.html) but you have asked for an opinion, generally what you have posted looks good, in that order 

What would I do however...

Interestingly I would take human first. If I start in Hommlet, there are heaps of Bandits to fight, a tough cleric to kill in the Moathouse. then later in ToEE there are plenty of human enemies to kill. 

Second could be goblinoid, after level 5 one might spend some time in Borderkeep Goblin area, later Critwall

Third could be Undead

Fourth Giants is a good choice. Maybe Vermin (https://nwn.fandom.com/wiki/Category:Vermin), or Aberration (https://nwn.fandom.com/wiki/Category:Aberrations) might be interesting. But I think overall Giants is what I would choose given there is a whole questline dedicated to defeating Giants

Fifth Elves sure, I haven't yet found my way to the Drow area yet but it sounds tough

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:Good builds, Orion, both of them.
Thanks for your kind words Valerfor

I actually think it would be better powergaming wise to take Dwarf as a race if Web goes for the pre-epic Ranger 20 levels, Cha is the dump stat here. Can drop Int to 13, keep Cons at 10 and put starting Str to 17, put all stat gains into Str and the ending Str will still be 28, 

except instead one gets Dwarven goodies such as +2 to saves against spells and poison, bonus to search when indoors, darkvision, racial bonuses against Goblins, Giants Orcs, lore check bonus etc... 

I had a look at Half-Orc on the NWN Wiki, and the racial bonuses are stats and darkvision which is very underwhelming in comparison

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Dwarf might be a good selection!

Up into the simo!

Sent from my SM-G955F using Tapatalk

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Web is on fire

@ Orion, back in the 1st edition of Dungeons & Dragons Half-Orcs gained both +1 Str & +1 Con (the equivalent of +2/+2 today) in exchange for their drawbacks, but in the transition to the 3rd edition of the game they only got back half of it, because Strength is assumed to count for two stats instead of just one. And yes, Dwarves are pretty much the best race by far, even for mages. Half-Orcs pretty much only work for Pen & Paper Barbarians where the lack of Intelligence don't hurt them so much & they only want more Strength, they do everything with it. In Neverwinter Nights though, Barbarian Rage counts towards the ability cap, so they are at a net loss from this rule (it would have been so much better instead, to just gain dmg bonuses).

posts.author: webshaman1

Ok, I have done my testing - and this build is really, really good!

It by far outmatches my fighter/monk/wm build!

And by that, I mean by over 10 AB!!!!

Of course, there is no Mind immunity (which could be a problem, but solvable), and no SR (which does tend to suck).

The damage output vs FEs is UNREAL!

posts.author: Valerfor

So much so, that I'll forget that this is a woodpecker build with farm implements & be stoic & even supportive of your decision...

Good hunting!
And may you find in your journeys, a legendary kama with 2d8 divine dmg, like the one I had on mine.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Now that would be a nice thing to find!

Sadly, even after over a year of play, the ONLY kama that I have found of any interest has been socketable kamas!

Which are nice, but nowhere near as good as that legendary (I do hope it has keen).

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
No, it wasn't anything else except 2d8 divine, BUT, with umd you can turn a twig, if you want, to +5, keen, flaming, on top of what already is, so it's fine, really.

And, even if you don't have umd, you can still flame it & keen it, with you know what...

You can also have a wizard-friend to make potions for you in case that you can't handle wands, anything is possible

posts.content:
Oh, I know the non-UMD tricks! :D

It's just that due to Dispel Spam, those properties get blown off these days, since becoming dispellable.

Still, 2d6 (or was that 2d8?) is not too shabby!

My socket Kamas are better, surprisingly!

+6 attack
+5 enhanced
+5 Divine
+5 Sonic
Keen
+3 Vampiric regen

I can Flame them for more!

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
webshaman1 wrote:I'm looking at Monk level 7 and scratching my head.

Level 6 would really be enough - the ability to heal 14 points/day is...meh.

So that would free up one level for somewhere else - maybe Ranger 27? Might then let me take a 6th FE...

Thoughts?
It's really to access Improved knockdown with Monk 6 before level 37, then tumble dump at the end, the 7th Monk level.
If you can live without it till late then overall Monk 6 would be a stronger level 40 build
If you can live without knockdown then Monk 2 would allow more free Ranger levels and bonus feats with monk two tumble dumps epic for Tumble 20 and Tumble 40 respectively
